cscd210Utils

Class SearchUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Utils.SearchUtils

  • public class SearchUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that contains a basic linearSearch and a basic binarySearch
    NOTE:
    All parameters to methods must be passed as final

    • Method Detail

      • linearSearch

        public static int linearSearch(java.lang.Comparable[] array,
                               java.lang.Comparable target)
        The linearSearch method is passed an array of type Comparable and a target that is Comparable. The methods starts at index 0 and goes to the end of the array checking the element against the target by using the equals method of the type. If the target does not match any value in the array then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        array - Representing an array of a type that has implemented Comparable and has a compareTo method
        target - Representing a parameter of a type that has implemented Comparable and has a compareTo method
        Returns:
        int Representing the index value of the element if found or -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is null or length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the target is null
        NOTE:
        We are using raw Comparable. Since we are using the equals method mismatched types are already handled.

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(java.lang.Comparable[] array,
                               java.lang.Comparable target)
        The binarySearch method is passed an array of type Comparable and a target that is Comparable. The methods starts at index 0 and goes to the end of the array checking the element against the target by using the equals method of the type. If the target does not match any value in the array then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        array - Representing an array of a type that has implemented Comparable and has a compareTo method
        target - Representing a parameter of a type that has implemented Comparable and has a compareTo method
        Returns:
        int Representing the index value of the element if found or -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is null or length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the target is null
        NOTE:
        We are using raw Comparable. Since we are using the compareTo method the compiler will complain and we will simply ignore the warning. For this lab we are guaranteed that the target and array will be of the same type.
